Exchange","slug":"the-exchange","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576765839"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576765839"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576765839"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576765839"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576765839"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":202,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/venture-capital\/","name":"venture capital","slug":"venture-capital","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/202"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=202"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=202"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=202"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=202"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[{"id":576796353,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/techcrunchplus\/fundraising\/","name":"Fundraising","slug":"fundraising","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796353"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796353"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576796356,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/techcrunchplus\/market-analysis\/","name":"Market Analysis","slug":"market-analysis","taxonomy":"tc_ec_category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category\/576796356"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_ec_category"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/tc_ec_category"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tc_ec_category=576796356"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[]]}},{"id":2290282,"date":"2022-03-31T06:16:08","date_gmt":"2022-03-31T13:16:08","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2290282"},"modified":"2022-03-31T08:34:54","modified_gmt":"2022-03-31T15:34:54","slug":"boxedup-seed-investment","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/31\/boxedup-seed-investment\/","title":{"rendered":"BoxedUp brings the sharing economy to high-end video production"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">The cameras, lenses and lighting equipment to shoot even a relatively modest production can cost in the millions of dollars. Rental is often the name of the game, but the latticework of mom-and-pop equipment rentals can be hard to navigate. <a href=\"https:\/\/tryboxedup.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">BoxedUp<\/a> takes a fresh look at the space, creating a rental marketplace &#8212; a Turo or Airbnb for video equipment if you will &#8212; where equipment owners can offer up their gear for rent.<\/p>\n<p>The company&#8217;s model works by aggregating listings from individual owners, local rental shops and manufacturers, giving content creators access to equipment, and owners a national platform to earn money on gear. For now, the company focuses on the U.S. only, but the investment will enable an upgrade of fulfillment capabilities, enabling BoxedUp to offer same-day delivery in key markets.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cWith this funding, BoxedUp can focus on expanding the capabilities of our platform, enabling us to better serve our customers, brands and local rental shops throughout the United States,\u201d Donald Boone, CEO and founder at BoxedUp, said of the funding round. The company recently closed $2.3 million, with money from Slauson &amp; Co., Collab Capital, Black Capital and Outlander VC. \u201cWe plan to build on this opportunity and grow our team, bringing on additional engineering talent and operational expertise.\u201d<\/p><div id=\"tc-target-mid-article-2290282\" class=\"tc-target-mid-article ad-unit--size-auto\"><\/div>\n<p>&#8220;The BoxedUp team is perfectly positioned to meet content creators where they are without the burden of equipment ownership and logistics while providing equipment owners a way to easily monetize their underutilized inventory,\u201d Ajay Relan, managing partner at <a href=\"https:\/\/www.slauson.co\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Slauson &amp; Co.<\/a>, explains the thinking behind the investment. &#8220;We&#8217;re excited for this intersection of the creator and shared economies and looking forward to supporting the vision and expansion of the platform.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>The company originally started as a rental company focusing on camera kits aimed at video conferences, virtual events and similar use cases.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;We were reacting quickly to many customer issues. The pandemic was on Full Tilt, and mainstream media really struggled with this idea that all of our talent is now absolutely dispersed throughout the world. And oh, by the way, they have really shitty cameras,&#8221; explains Boone. &#8220;I tested out a couple of camera kits, and it was looking great. A friend recommended that I should start pitching these kits to mainstream media outlets. The first company we sold to was <a href=\"https:\/\/blavity.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Blavity<\/a>. And then we picked up NPR and Amazon and Google and then the ball just got rolling really quickly.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>BoxedUp had stumbled into a market where the traditional players weren&#8217;t serving the customer need; high-end Hollywood productions have their own systems for renting equipment, but for the vastly sized long-tail of small and medium-sized creators, there was nothing with the ease of use that the rest of the internet has gotten used to. Once the company had a little bit of traction, things started snowballing.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"LjGHJkwZPZ\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/09\/how-to-calculate-your-startups-tam-sam-and-som\/\">How to calculate your startup&#8217;s TAM, SAM and SOM<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe class=\"wp-embedded-content\" sandbox=\"allow-scripts\" security=\"restricted\" style=\"position: absolute; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);\" title=\"&#8220;How to calculate your startup&#8217;s TAM, SAM and SOM&#8221; &#8212; TechCrunch\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/09\/how-to-calculate-your-startups-tam-sam-and-som\/embed\/#?secret=XE0n2eXlZu#?secret=LjGHJkwZPZ\" data-secret=\"LjGHJkwZPZ\" width=\"800\" height=\"450\" frameborder=\"0\" marginwidth=\"0\" marginheight=\"0\" scrolling=\"no\"><\/iframe><\/div>\n<p>&#8220;Do you guys do documentary work? Do you have anything to make renting equipment for documentaries easier,&#8221; Boone recalls the questions started coming in. &#8220;We got to thinking &#8216;I wonder how this experience looks like if you&#8217;re shooting a movie or a music video,&#8217; and we came to find out it&#8217;s actually pretty miserable. At the moment it&#8217;s all email transactions. A cinematographer or videographer writes something in the notes app of their iPhone, and sends it to a rental shop. Sometimes they&#8217;re DMing people.&#8221;<\/p>\n<p>Building a marketplace to make these types of rentals easier was the obvious next step.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;We found a <span style=\"font-size: 1rem; letter-spacing: -0.1px;\">$10 billion opportunity where owner-operators are renting things out via Instagram and rental shops are still using really old websites,&#8221; says Boone. &#8220;We think that there was an opportunity for us to be the technology platform, the marketplace. The equipment owners don&#8217;t want to deal with the tech &#8212; they&#8217;re artists at the end of the day.&#8221;<\/span><\/p>\n<p>In the early days, the company stocked its own equipment, and it would work with manufacturers, who would send them their open-box or cosmetically damaged items. The company would rent out on their behalf. Of course, high-end equipment is expensive, and the company decided it would make more sense to utilize the equipment that sits unused most of the time, connecting it with creators that need access to high-end video equipment.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;Instead of spending $30,000 to buy a camera to rent out one at a time, we could instead create the platform to connect people that <em>have<\/em> that $30,000 camera. So we&#8217;ve sort of shifted real-time and during COVID we owned everything, but right now our entire go-to-market is 100% empowering the local mom-and-pop rental shops and the individual owner-operators,&#8221; says Boone.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>The cameras, lenses and lighting equipment to shoot even a relatively modest production can cost in the millions of dollars. Rental is often the name of the game, but the latticework of mom-and-pop equipment rentals can be hard to navigate. BoxedUp takes a fresh look at the space, creating a rental marketplace &#8212; a Turo &amp; Co","slug":"slauson-co","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576998900"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576998900"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576998900"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576998900"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576998900"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":449557042,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/startups\/","name":"Startups","slug":"startups","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/449557042"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=449557042"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=449557042"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=449557042"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=449557042"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2291651,"date":"2022-03-31T06:01:17","date_gmt":"2022-03-31T13:01:17","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2291651"},"modified":"2022-03-31T08:40:43","modified_gmt":"2022-03-31T15:40:43","slug":"slingshot-aerospace-scores-25m-space-force-contract-to-build-digital-twin-space-simulator","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/31\/slingshot-aerospace-scores-25m-space-force-contract-to-build-digital-twin-space-simulator\/","title":{"rendered":"Slingshot Aerospace scores $25M Space Force contract to build &#8216;digital twin&#8217; space simulator"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Space simulation and analytics company Slingshot Aerospace has been awarded a $25.2 million, 39-month contract by the U.S. Space Force (USSF) to further develop and deliver two of its products: Digital Space Twin and Slingshot Laboratory. The contract was funded by Space Systems Command and the USSF\u2019s venture branch, SpaceWERX.<\/p>\n<p>Digital Space Twin is a virtual environment that not only provides a realistic simulation of the physics at play in orbit, but also reflects what\u2019s going on in space in real time, using multiple data sources to map the current location of bodies in orbit (satellites and space junk) and account for space weather. The program can be used to simulate missions as well as plan for future satellite constellations \u2014 something beneficial for governmental and commercial entities alike.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cIt was important to us since the very beginning to create products that work for both government and commercial use,\u201d Melanie Stricklan, Slingshot Aerospace\u2019s co-founder and CEO tells TechCrunch. \u201cIt will take a collective effort across all commercial, government and civil organizations to ensure that space remains a tenet of our global economy for generations to come, which is why our products have gained traction in both sectors.\u201d<\/p><div id=\"tc-target-mid-article-2291651\" class=\"tc-target-mid-article ad-unit--size-auto\"><\/div>\n<p>For defense agencies, in particular, Digital Space Twin can also be used for war games. (Ender\u2019s Game, anyone?) Per a press release, \u201cthe USSF will use Slingshot Aerospace\u2019s Digital Space Twin to visualize potential nefarious acts that could occur in orbit. By being apprised of and understanding the impact of current threats, users can employ known data to plan and simulate responses and predict future adversary behavior in order to maintain national security.\u201d<\/p>\n<p>Slingshot Laboratory, on the other hand, is a training program with virtual environments that reflect astrodynamics and astronautics \u2014 essentially it\u2019s a physics-driven sandbox game to help students conceptualize the space environment in an immersive, interactive way. The USSF plans to run pilot programs at Basic Military Training (BMT), the National Security Space Institute (NSSI), the 319th Combat Training Squadron and the 533rd Training Squadron.<\/p>\n<p>Before the USSF\u2019s investment, Slingshot Aerospace\u2019s primary product was Slingshot Beacon, a satellite collision avoidance program whose clients will comprise 63% of all satellite constellations in low Earth orbit by the end of 2022. The program <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/10\/slingshot-aerospace-raises-25m-to-help-satellite-operators-navigate-space-traffic\/\">recently raised $34.6 million<\/a> over a two-part Series A round, but it does face competition from companies like <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/06\/03\/leolabs-raises-65m-series-b-for-its-satellite-monitoring-and-collision-detection-service\/\">LeoLabs<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2020\/10\/13\/kayhan-space-wants-to-be-the-air-traffic-control-service-for-satellites-in-space\/\">Kayhan Space<\/a>. But Slingshot\u2019s priorities may be shifting with the new contract.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cSlingshot\u2019s Digital Space Twin is quickly gaining fidelity with the large investments our company has privately made towards the product in addition to the investments we have received from the government,\u201d says Stricklan. \u201cOur Digital Space Twin is on track to soon become our flagship product due to the clear value it has for a vast array of customers across the industry including spacecraft owner-operators, launch operators, manufacturers, insurers, and future space-related product developers.\u201d<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>It\u2019s a classic case of where the money goes, innovation will follow.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Space simulation and analytics company Slingshot Aerospace has been awarded a $25.2 million, 39-month contract by the U.S. Space Force (USSF) to further develop and deliver two of its products: Digital Space Twin and Slingshot Laboratory. The contract was funded by Space Systems Command and the USSF\u2019s venture branch, SpaceWERX. Digital Space Twin is a Aerospace","slug":"slingshot-aerospace","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576815443"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576815443"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576815443"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576815443"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576815443"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":449557093,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/space\/","name":"Space","slug":"space","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/449557093"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=449557093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=449557093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=449557093"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=449557093"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576781803,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/u-s-space-force\/","name":"U.S. Space Force","slug":"u-s-space-force","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576781803"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576781803"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576781803"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576781803"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576781803"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2291478,"date":"2022-03-31T06:01:13","date_gmt":"2022-03-31T13:01:13","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2291478"},"modified":"2022-03-31T07:12:15","modified_gmt":"2022-03-31T14:12:15","slug":"archie-aims-to-remove-the-complexity-of-managing-freelancers","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/31\/archie-aims-to-remove-the-complexity-of-managing-freelancers\/","title":{"rendered":"Archie aims to remove the complexity of managing freelancers"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">As more people moved to remote work over the past few years, there was also an uptick in people choosing freelance or contract work, leaving companies to figure out how to manage that worker segment.<\/p>\n<p>If you are one of those having to find work and manage payments, tax filings and invoices, there\u2019s help from a number of startups &#8212; for example, Bill.com and <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/02\/17\/remote-hiring-startup-deel-gives-businesses-the-option-to-run-their-payroll-in-crypto\/\">Deel<\/a> that are business-facing and freelancer-focused ones <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/03\/04\/this-pan-african-freelance-platform-is-the-first-zimbabwean-startup-backed-by-techstars\/\">AfriBlocks<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/05\/31\/malt-raises-97m-at-a-489m-valuation-for-its-freelance-marketplace-for-developers\/\">Malt<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/05\/13\/worksome-pulls-13m-into-its-high-skill-freelancer-talent-platform\/\">Worksome<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/18\/meaningful-gigs-raises-6m-seed-to-link-designers-in-africa-with-remote-jobs-from-us-companies\/\">Meaningful Gigs<\/a>, <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/04\/london-based-steadypay-helps-freelancers-and-gig-workers-stabilize-their-income\/\">SteadyPay<\/a> and <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/11\/02\/independent-worker-network-contra-goes-commission-free-as-it-secures-new-nea-led-capital\/\">Contra<\/a>\u00a0&#8212; that have developed different approaches to making this easier.<\/p>\n<p>The latest to receive funding to continue developing its financial infrastructure for the freelance economy is <a href=\"https:\/\/witharchie.com\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Archie<\/a>, which raised $4.5 million in funding from B Capital Group, Mac Ventures, Worklife Ventures, Hof VC, Dash Fund, Day One Ventures, Behance founder Scott Belsky and other company founders from the likes of Cameo, Blank Street, Ramp, BloomTech and Eight Sleep.<\/p><div id=\"tc-target-mid-article-2291478\" class=\"tc-target-mid-article ad-unit--size-auto\"><\/div>\n<p>Co-founders Yunas Reguero, Cassandra Aaron and Dylan Hattem started Archie last April and officially launched three months later. What they\u2019ve developed is a collaboration hub for businesses working with freelancers to manage all that comes with it \u2014 onboarding, contracts, payments, accounting and tax filings \u2014 with the ability to pay freelancers in one click.<\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2291497\" style=\"width: 360px\" class=\"wp-caption alignright\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2291497\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\"vertical wp-image-2291497\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?w=453\" alt=\"Archie, Cassandra Aaron, Yunas Reguero\" width=\"350\" height=\"525\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg 3648w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=100,150 100w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=200,300 200w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=768,1152 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=453,680 453w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=1024,1536 1024w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=1365,2048 1365w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Archie-Cassandra-Aaron-and-Yunas-Reguero.jpg?resize=33,50 33w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 350px) 100vw, 350px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2291497\" class=\"wp-caption-text\">Archie co-founders Cassandra Aaron and Yunas Reguero.\u00a0<strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Archie<\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>Aaron and Reguero, who have been friends for years, saw the trend of over <a href=\"https:\/\/www.statista.com\/statistics\/921593\/gig-economy-number-of-freelancers-us\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">half of the working population shifting to freelance<\/a>, with that number likely to <a href=\"https:\/\/www.statista.com\/statistics\/921593\/gig-economy-number-of-freelancers-us\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">surpass 90 million<\/a> by 2028. Despite that opportunity, they thought freelancers still lacked access to financial services and were at the mercy of companies treating them like vendors and paying them in 30 days or longer for completed work.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cWe are on a mission to \u2018unfuck\u2019 the freelance economy,\u201d she told TechCrunch. Aaron estimates that Archie is saving its customers hours of time that they can now use to focus on growth-related opportunities.<\/p>\n<p>Their approach is catching on. Since last April, Archie is seeing $15 million in payment volume run-rate, up eight times since July 2021 alone. In addition, their growth is driven in large part by word of mouth \u2014 freelancers taking Archie with them to new employers as their preferred method of doing business with clients.<\/p>\n<p>The new funding enables the company to boost its engineering team and technology development as it starts to amp up its efforts on the growth side, Reguero said.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>Their plan going forward includes leveraging its structured knowledge about payments to underwrite products and build additional financial services for freelancers, including banking, savings, credit and income verification.<\/p>\n<p>\u201cWe will continue to focus on growth, building out different layers of the platform,\u201d Reguero added. \u201cThat includes providing ways for contracts and other forms to get signed before someone comes on, as well as investing in international payments so businesses have the ability to pay contractors in other countries. Ultimately, we want to make this as seamless as possible.\u201d<\/p>\n<div class=\"embed breakout\">\n<blockquote class=\"wp-embedded-content\" data-secret=\"D4E0Ferbgh\"><p><a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2018\/10\/31\/freelancers-rights-come-of-age-as-gig-economy-booms\/\">Freelancers rights come of age as gig economy booms<\/a><\/p><\/blockquote>\n<p><iframe Fund","slug":"dash-fund","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576881211"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576881211"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576881211"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576881211"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576881211"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":576602810,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/day-one-ventures\/","name":"day one ventures","slug":"day-one-ventures","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/576602810"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=576602810"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=576602810"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=576602810"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=576602810"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":8590,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/economy\/","name":"economy","slug":"economy","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/8590"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=8590"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=8590"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=8590"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=8590"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":7915,"link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/tag\/employment\/","name":"employment","slug":"employment","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags\/7915"}],"collection":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tags"}],"about":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/taxonomies\/post_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/posts?tags=7915"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/battlefield-companies?tags=7915"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc-media-gallery?tags=7915"},{"href":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-json\/wp\/v2\/tc_video?tags=7915"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\/\/api.w.org\/{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[],[],[],[]]}},{"id":2291741,"date":"2022-03-31T06:00:33","date_gmt":"2022-03-31T13:00:33","guid":{"rendered":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/?p=2291741"},"modified":"2022-03-31T08:52:57","modified_gmt":"2022-03-31T15:52:57","slug":"founded-by-ex-dlocal-and-astropay-execs-datanomik-is-bringing-open-banking-to-latam","status":"publish","type":"post","link":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/31\/founded-by-ex-dlocal-and-astropay-execs-datanomik-is-bringing-open-banking-to-latam\/","title":{"rendered":"Founded by ex-dLocal and AstroPay execs, Datanomik is bringing open banking to LatAm"},"content":{"rendered":"<p id=\"speakable-summary\">Cross-border payments platform dLocal is one of the most notable Latin American startups in recent history &#8212; the company became Uruguay&#8217;s first unicorn in 2020 and went public on the Nasdaq in 2021. DLocal&#8217;s founders had first launched AstroPay, another digital payments platform that now has over five million users.<\/p>\n<p>Now, dLocal and AstroPay co-founder Sergio Fogel has teamed up with AstroPay&#8217;s former head of product, Gonzalo Strauss, to launch another fintech out of Montevideo, Uruguay, called <a href=\"https:\/\/www.datanomik.com\/en\/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Datanomik<\/a>. Datanomik&#8217;s goal is to connect financial institutions across LatAm through its B2B open finance API, which gathers a company&#8217;s banking information on one platform, Strauss told TechCrunch.<\/p>\n<p>Strauss dreamed up the idea for Datanomik as a solution to some of the pain points he had faced working at AstroPay processing payments in emerging markets.<\/p><div id=\"tc-target-mid-article-2291741\" class=\"tc-target-mid-article ad-unit--size-auto\"><\/div>\n<p>Cash is still the primary payment method of choice in emerging markets, which posed challenges to fintech companies like AstroPay in reconciling their payments to understand their bank account balances and cash flow, according to Strauss.<\/p>\n<p>Different banks all have their own reporting interfaces and platforms that customers can access, and many don&#8217;t give customers APIs to be able to access their own data. When banks do provide APIs to customers, they often come in different formats, from PDFs to CSVs, so as a company with multiple bank accounts, it&#8217;s a tedious process to log into each different account and gather information in order to gain a consolidated view of the company&#8217;s financial position, he added.<\/p>\n<p><div id=\"attachment_2291804\" style=\"width: 378px\" class=\"wp-caption alignright\"><img aria-describedby=\"caption-attachment-2291804\" loading=\"lazy\" class=\" wp-image-2291804\" src=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?w=300\" alt=\"Datanomik co-founders Sergio Fogel and Gonzalo Strauss\" width=\"368\" height=\"239\" srcset=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg 2000w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=150,98 150w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=300,195 300w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=768,499 768w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=680,442 680w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=1536,998 1536w, https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2022\/03\/Datanomik_techcrunch.jpg?resize=50,33 50w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 368px) 100vw, 368px\" \/><p id=\"caption-attachment-2291804\" class=\"wp-caption-text\"><em>Datanomik co-founders Sergio Fogel and Gonzalo Strauss. <strong>Image Credits:<\/strong> Datanomik<\/em><\/p><\/div><\/p>\n<p>&#8220;There was no easy way of interacting with our bank accounts. Basically what we were doing was manually entering our own bank [information] every five to 10 minutes to get all of transactions, to get our balances, to get all of our different bank accounts and reconcile the payments, get support and reconciliation, and more &#8230; I decided this was not a scalable solution,&#8221; Strauss said.<\/p><div class=\"piano-inline-promo\"><\/div>\n<p>The open banking system seemed promising to Strauss as a potential solution that could help companies like AstroPay automate their processes and receive more streamlined banking information. Open banking seeks to bypass traditional financial rails by allowing banks to give developers access to their data through APIs. The technology has taken off with <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2021\/09\/20\/truelayer-nabs-130m-at-a-1b-valuation-as-open-banking-rises-as-a-viable-option-to-card-networks\/\">startups like TrueLayer in the U.K.<\/a>, where regulators were early to greenlight open banking solutions, and Plaid in the U.S.<\/p>\n<p>But when Strauss searched for a solution in LatAm that would fit the needs of businesses in the region, he came up empty &#8212; so he decided to build it himself. His work started out as an internal project within AstroPay, but after developing the idea, Strauss approached Fogel, his manager at the time, and pitched him on launching the project as a standalone company.<\/p>\n<p>Fogel was impressed by Strauss&#8217;s pitch and ended up gauging interest from some of his investor contacts, including fintech-focused partner Angela Strange at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z). Strauss&#8217;s venture didn&#8217;t have an official name yet &#8212; all he had was the product itself and the pitch he had delivered to Fogel &#8212; but that was enough to pique the interest of Strange and her team.<\/p>\n<p>Fast-forward three months to today, and Datanomik, Strauss&#8217;s venture, announced it has raised a $6 million seed round led by a16z. LatAm-focused venture firms Canary, Nazca and Latitud also participated in the round, alongside prominent angel investors from other tech startups and banks.<\/p>\n<p>The financing marks a16z&#8217;s first investment in Uruguay, and one of its biggest seed rounds in Latin America.<\/p>\n<p>Datanomik has five customers today, though Strauss did not name specific ones. The company says its goal is to help companies like dLocal or <a href=\"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/2022\/03\/22\/fintech-startup-jeeves-raises-180m-quadruples-valuation-to-2-1b\/\">corporate expense management platform Jeeves<\/a>, which rely on analyzing companies&#8217; bank statements to do business.<\/p>\n<p>Although it is headquartered in Uruguay, Strauss said Datanomik&#8217;s main target market is Brazil, both because of its larger population size and because the country&#8217;s central bank and regulators are in their final phase of adopting an open banking framework. He added that Datanomik also has its sights set on Mexico and Colombia, which are both in the process of adopting an open banking system as well, though they are in earlier stages than Brazil. Eventually, Strauss hopes to expand the product across the LatAm region to businesses in Uruguay, Peru, Argentina and other countries that face similar challenges.<\/p>\n<p>&#8220;If you have a company that has subsidiaries in, let&#8217;s say, Mexico, Brazil and Colombia, and the CFO wants to know, how much money do I have in my bank accounts, through Datanomik you will be able to, through one API, get a unified picture of all of these accounts,&#8221; Strauss said.<\/p>\n","protected":false},"excerpt":{"rendered":"<p>Cross-border payments platform dLocal is one of the most notable Latin American startups in recent history &#8212; the company became Uruguay&#8217;s first unicorn in 2020 and went public on the Nasdaq in 2021. DLocal&#8217;s founders had first launched AstroPay, another digital payments platform that now has over five million users. Now, dLocal and AstroPay co-founder [&hellip;]<\/p>\n","protected":false},"author":133574498,"featured_media":2224671,"comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"template":"","format":"standard","meta":{"outcome":"","status":"","crunchbase_tag":0,"amp_status":"","relegenceEntities":[],"relegenceSubjects":[],"carmot_uuid":"2d5361b3-0e07-3df1-91d6-74fdf93c6e88"},"categories":[449557044,15835174,576602978,60523764,576597428,576602979,20429,17396,35394854],"tags":[34024015,22350935,576608247,18939,26653,4390,21691,577000552,576595252,449557099,576668608,216504,576887658,311295,5839,783,576601593,576838283,449557042,449557049,12693,202],"crunchbase_tag":[],"tc_stories_tax":[],"tc_ec_category":[],"tc_event":[],"jetpack_featured_media_url":"https:\/\/techcrunch.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2021\/10\/GettyImages-860508768.jpg","parsely":{"version":"1.0.0","meta":{"@context":"http:\/\/schema.org","@type":"WebPage","headline":"Biden&#039;s 400\">Mathilde Collin, co-founder and CEO of Front, raised capital from a handful of less than traditional VCs including Okta\u2019s COO and co-founder, Frederic Kerrest. Dr. Miller has a PhD in Mathematics from the University of Notre Dame. Named \"one of the most technically proficient hackers on Earth\" by Foreign Policy, Dr. Miller has found countless vulnerabilities in a number of Apple products and is known as the first hacker to remotely exploit the iPhone and the first Android phone. He has won the \u201cSuper Bowl\u201d of computer hacking, the annual Pwn2Own competition four times. Dr. Miller has extensive automotive security expertise and demonstrated that a variety of Fiat Chrysler vehicles, including the 2014 Jeep Cherokee, could be remotely hacked from anywhere in the country and he could control the radio, brakes, wipers, transmission, acceleration, and even the steering of the target vehicle. Brown is CEO and founder of Impossible Foods, a company at the forefront of making nutritious, delicious meat and dairy products from plants to satisfy meat lovers and address the environmental impact of animal farming.<\/p>\n\n<p>The idea for Impossible Foods came to Pat while he was on sabbatical from his position as an HHMI investigator and professor of biochemistry at the Stanford University School of Medicine. In reflecting on how he could use his training and experience to make the largest positive impact on the world, he realized there was a way to make delicious, affordable meat and dairy products, directly from plants \u2013 that would be better for the environment and for consumers. In 2011, Pat chose to devote himself full time to Impossible Foods.<\/p>\n\n<p>After receiving his BA, MD and PhD (in Biochemistry) at the University of Chicago, Pat completed a residency in pediatrics at Chicago\u2019s Children\u2019s Memorial Hospital. As a fellow with Mike Bishop and Harold Varmus, he defined the mechanism by which HIV and other retroviruses incorporate their genes into the genomes of the cells they infect.<\/p>\n\n<p>At Stanford, Pat and colleagues developed DNA microarrays \u2013 a new technology that made it possible to monitor the activity of all the genes in a genome \u2013 along with the first methods for analyzing, visualizing and interpreting global gene expression programs.<\/p>\n\n<p>He pioneered the use of gene expression patterns to classify cancers and improve prediction of their clinical course. He has also been a leader in making scientific and medical research results freely available to scientists, physicians and the public. With Harold Varmus, then Director of the National Institutes of Health, and Berkeley professor Michael Eisen, he founded the Public Library of Science, a nonprofit scientific publisher that has transformed the publishing industry by making scientific and medical research results freely available to the public.<\/p>\n\n<p>He is a member of the National Academy of Sciences and the Institute of Medicine and recipient of the American Cancer Society Medal of Honor.
